isis.stitle: NEWAY AD-123/246 DRIVE AXLE AIR SUSPENSIONS - OPERATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: This suspension uses air drawn from the truck/tractor air system to pressurize the air springs. The height control valve regulates the air pressure required for varying loads. This suspension can provide a cushioned ride throughout the load range, from empty to fully loaded. The suspension also provides excellent side-to-side and axle-to-axle loading which helps equalize and control braking.

step1.para: The cab air switch in the instrument panel has two positions: RUN and DUMP. In the RUN position, the valve is closed. Placing the valve in the DUMP position opens the valve and directs air pressure to the inversion valve located near the height control valve, which dumps air from the air springs. With the cab air switch in the DUMP position, a ground circuit is closed, illuminating a warning light on the instrument panel.

step2.para: The air supply to the height control valve comes from the primary reservoir. On vehicles with Cab Air Control, the air supply to the height control valve comes from the inversion (TR-3) valve. Air is delivered from the height control valve to the air springs.

Placing the cab air switch in the DUMP position directs air to the inversion valve, causing it to stop the air supply to the height control valve and dumps the air from the air springs through the exhaust port on the inversion valve.
Placing the cab air switch in the RUN position returns air spring control to the height control valve and the air springs will inflate to the pre- determined vehicle ride height.
